title: Match Selection and Refinement for Highly Accurate Two-View Structure from Motion

author: Zhe Liu, École des Ponts ParisTech, MINES ParisTech

segmentation: Hello everyone, my name is Lucia.
Today I will present my work to improve the accuracy of two view structure from motion which is a joint work with Pascal, Magnus and her normally in the Group of Imagine.
In the lab now IGN.
We will first recall the standard 2 view structure from motion given 2 images, we will generate features and produce an initial matches.
Then we will apply a match selection strategy such as ransack to separate inliers and outliers.
The fundamental matrix is estimated according to the inliers.
Finally, given the intrinsic camera parameters, we can estimate the rotation and translation of the camera.
To improve the accuracy of the structure from motion process, what we did is to use a better match selection strategy.
So to do that, we write our big question.
If using all inliers for fundamental matrix estimation, the best thing to do in fact during the match selection stage, we do have the choice.
Between using more matches with lower accuracy or less matches with higher accuracy.
And our objective is to find a subset of most accurate matches to achieve a better structure for motion.
So we begin by studying the impact of quality and quantity of matches on the reconstruction errors.
We ran our experiments on real on real data set where we can vary the quality by controlling the variance.
Sigma 2D of match localization error and we can control the varying.
The quantity by varying the number of matches.

But we observed that Alpha over beta is superior to two for almost 4 almost things.
So we look for lower bound gamma smaller than Alpha over beta, which is enough for us to compare errors.
Such as the relation six.
We say that gamma equal to two is a safe value for every for most things.
And besides, Alpha over beta equal to two is theoretically proved for the case of Homographic transformation.
If we set gamma to zero, we come back to the traditional way, saying that we will take as much as possible the inliers.
So our goal is to find a subset N which minimize F squared divided by the number of matches.
However, exploring all subsets is impractical and will have a lot of biased local minimum.
Our solution here is to use a scoring function file in which a smaller value of five means a better quality of a match.
